text:
Well, after Biden spent months denying the crisis and the liberals on social media crowed about how safe the border was on Biden’s watch, now he’s changing his tune. He wants to build more wall. Looks like President Trump was right all along.
foxnews.com/media/biden-admi…
Each of these conservative victories were accomplished despite the narrowest majority in history. But now, that agenda is at risk at a time we can least afford it.

Under McCarthy’s speakership, the House has passed legislation to secure the southern border, unleash America’s energy potential, ensure parents have a say in what their children learn in the classroom, provide for our veterans, & overturn the Biden's crippling COVID mandates.

I’ve said it before and I’ll say it again: if conservatives truly want to defend our values, then we must stop fighting each other and start taking it to the liberals who voted in lockstep against Kevin McCarthy today.
politico.com/news/2023/10/02…

Turns out the Biden administration is concerned about corruption in the Ukrainian government, too. America will always remain the world's leading force for peace and democracy, but there must be transparency and accountability for every American tax dollar sent to Ukraine.
I recently took to the House Floor to pay tribute to his legacy. We will miss you, Bill. Thank you for everything.

The Honorable William “Bill” Black, who I served with in the state legislature, passed away on September 9th. Bill was a close friend of mine and a mentor. Our state, country, and the lives he touched are better off for having known him.

I voted today against a "CR" to fund the government for the next 45 days because it was stripped of any spending reforms or border security measures. If we don’t fix these problems now, what shape is this country going to be in when we leave it to our children and grandchildren?
If you or a veteran you know is having thoughts of suicide, call the Veterans Crisis Line at 988 and press 1 to receive free, confidential support.

Seventeen. Seventeen veterans are still lost to suicide every single day. September is National Suicide Prevention month, and I recently took to the House floor to remind those who need help that you are not alone.

I've been in close contact with the Effingham County board chairman & the sheriff, as well as the mayor of Teutopolis to offer any help my office can provide. Tracy and I are keeping the families affected by this disaster in our prayers.

Last night a semitruck carrying toxic chemicals overturned in an accident near Teutopolis causing several casualties & extensive evacuations. This is an ongoing situation, but we’re quickly learning the tragic consequences for people in the area. apnews.com/article/teutopoli…

Earlier this year I traveled to Eagle Pass, Texas to meet with border agents and review security measures firsthand. What I saw was a dedicated security force that's overworked and undermanned because of the Biden administration's failed border policies.
Just last weekend there were 4,000 migrant encounters at Eagle Pass alone. We must secure the border and finish the wall NOW.

The Democrat-controlled Senate, on the other hand, has passed zero appropriations bills. If the government shuts down, remember that House Republicans sought to restore certainty for American families, while the Washington Democrats failed to act.
The House has passed spending bills for military construction, veterans’ programs, defense, homeland security, and the State Department. That’s over 70% of government operations, responsibly funded.
As the clock ticks closer to a government shutdown, House conservatives are fighting to end the border crisis and keep essential government services funded.

As one of the few former firefighters in Congress, it’s a personal mission for me to ensure our firefighters receive help to continue their life saving work. My role as co-chair of the Congressional Fire Services Caucus provides an important platform to see that mission through.

I’m proud to support the Assistance to Firefighters Grants & Staffing for Adequate Fire & Emergency Response programs by sponsoring an amendment to the Homeland Security Appropriations bill to make sure our firefighters have safe & effective facilities, gear, staff, & support.

Today I cosponsored the Define the Mission Act to provide transparency for how American taxpayer dollars are used in Ukraine. This would require the president to submit to Congress a comprehensive plan for where our money’s going & how it supports US national security interests.
The needs of the American people must come first.
The USDA should be empowering our farmers and producers, not selling them out to please environmental activists.

Southern Illinoisans have had enough of Green New Deal mandates. Proud that the House approved my amendment to stop Biden’s Agriculture Department from using our taxpayer dollars to convert their fleet of cars and trucks to costlier electric vehicles.

This morning I had the honor of welcoming another Southern Illinois Honor Flight to Washington. It’s always an incredible experience to share part of the day with these great Americans as they visit the military memorials in our nation’s capital.

Prairie du Rocher was founded by the French over 300 years ago. This week, I introduced legislation to establish the Prairie du Rocher French Colonial National Historical Park so that we can preserve this important piece of our history for generations to come.

National Blue Ribbon Schools are incredible institutions for learning that help lift entire communities. Congratulations to the students, teachers, and parents at these schools for such a tremendous achievement!

The Dept. of Education has designated Franklin Elementary School in Metropolis, Lebanon Elementary School, & Teutopolis Junior High School as National Blue Ribbon Schools in recognition of their overall academic excellence & progress in closing achievement gaps among students.
We look forward to being your advocate and doing all we can to help. In the meantime, feel free to reach out to our Effingham office at (217) 240-3170.

My staff will be hosting mobile office hours in Lawrenceville on Thursday, September 28th to give you an opportunity to talk with our casework experts face-to-face about any questions you may have regarding veterans' benefits, Social Security, Medicare, the IRS, and more.

As a Member of the FFA Caucus, I’m happy to share that my colleagues and I introduced a resolution today declaring September 21st #NationalTeachAgDay. Thank you to all our agricultural educators in Southern Illinois!

FEMA’s current evaluation system for providing disaster relief is unfair to rural areas. Small towns and farming communities shouldn’t be turned away for disaster relief they desperately need just because their population numbers are overshadowed by big cities and suburbs.

Today I introduced the Rural Disaster Declaration Fairness Act, which will make sure rural residents, including right here in Southern Illinois, have improved access to relief following a natural disaster.

To understand the needs of our farmers/producers, you have to meet them on their turf & in their fields. It’s why I meet with our farmers frequently, hosted a farm tour in Aug, & keep in close contact with a local agriculture advisory board I formed when I first went to Congress.

There’s a lot of uncertainty in Washington, but one thing’s for sure: we need a Farm Bill that empowers our farmers and grows our rural economy. In my position on the House Agriculture Committee, I’m fighting to get it done.
washingtonexaminer.com/resto…
We look forward to being your advocate and doing all we can to help. In the meantime, feel free to reach out to our Murphysboro office at (618) 457-5787.

My staff will be hosting mobile office hours in Benton on Wednesday, September 27th to give you an opportunity to talk with our casework experts face-to-face about any questions you may have regarding veterans' benefits, Social Security, Medicare, the IRS, and more.

U.S. Marine Captain Eleanor LeBeau Cooke of Belleville perished in a training mission in Australia last month. Her impact on her community and country will be remembered. I was humbled to honor her legacy in a speech on the House floor this afternoon. Semper Fidelis, Marine.

When I visited the southern border at Eagle Pass, TX this spring, the leftists howled. They said it was a wasted trip, that Biden had the border secured. Well, Eagle Pass is now a “total free for all.” Saw it coming. But Biden continues to ignore this national security nightmare.

This is one of the Congress's most important bills, setting policy priorities for military & defense for the upcoming year. As the rep for @ScottAFB & thousands of active duty servicemembers, I look forward to being part of the process in strengthening America’s military mission.

Honored to announce I’ve been appointed to serve on the House-Senate Conference Committee for the Defense Authorization bill. In special circumstances the leaders of both parties in both chambers form a Conference Committee to iron out differences on a major piece of legislation.
Happy 76th birthday to the @usairforce! I’m honored to represent @ScottAFB and so many men and women who have served and continue to serve in the greatest flying force the world has ever seen.

To any young patriots in Southern IL seeking to serve our country, my office is extending the application deadline for nominations to US military academies until 10/27/23. More info available by calling our Effingham office at (217) 240-3170 or by visiting bost.house.gov/military-acad…
We look forward to being your advocate and doing all we can to help. In the meantime, feel free to reach out to our Murphysboro office at (618) 457-5787.

My staff will be hosting mobile office hours in Simpson on Friday, Sept. 22nd to give you an opportunity to talk with our casework experts face-to-face about any questions you may have regarding veterans' benefits, Social Security, Medicare, the IRS, & more.

That’s especially true for veterans who have suffered injury or long-term physical disability in the military. They deserve to know their nation and their government will honor their service and do all they can to help them.

Last week, I met with Robert Thomas & Heather Ansley to discuss the Elizabeth Dole Home Care Act and other @PVA1946 priorities. 

Fighting for those who served this great nation is the most important part of my role as chairman of the House Veterans’ Affairs Committee.

Today we celebrate #ConstitutionDay. Signed on September 17, 1787, the U.S. The Constitution lays out the fundamental values of liberty, freedom, and self-governance and it continues to be my life’s mission to make sure its principles are upheld.
I am thankful for the great work this organization is doing to empower Americans to overcome their physical or cognitive challenges.

I had the honor of being presented a Certificate of Appreciation from @SourceAmerica for the work we’re doing to create jobs and opportunities for individuals with disabilities, including veterans who were injured in combat.
Today, on National POW/MIA Recognition Day, we honor the heroes who were Prisoners of War and those who served and never made it home. Thank you to all who have served.

When they’re training their employees to believe that "an abortion is ten times safer than carrying a pregnancy to term," I have serious questions about whether they have the capability of providing proper health care guidance to our veterans.

The Biden administration has stonewalled Congress time and again as we seek answers for how they’re implementing their abortion policies and which health conditions they use to justify carrying out the procedures.

When taxpayer dollars are being used to fund abortion services at the VA, the American people deserve to know about it. If the administration remains unresponsive, I won’t hesitate to use subpoena authority to get answers. You can read our letter to VA Secretary McDonough below.

This morning I had breakfast with members of the Illinois Business Council in DC, where we discussed legislation on the agenda for the House and how we’re working to improve conditions for job creators and working families across Southern Illinois. Thanks for having me!

The Far Left liberals are working to ban the sale of new vehicles with internal combustion engines. Their laws have a big market impact on the rest of us, including in Southern IL, where local car dealers tell me they can barely move electric vehicles off their sales lots.
I voted today to protect your freedom to choose the car YOU want to drive. You want to drive a Prius? Go for it. But I’m sticking to my gas-powered Chevy truck.

I was honored to be presented the 2023 Fueling Growth Award today by @GrowthEnergy, the leading org for biofuels in America. Ethanol helps fuel Southern IL’s agricultural economy & is a critical part of our energy independence. Always proud to stand with our farmers & producers!
House Republicans will get to the bottom of this corruption and fight to preserve the integrity of the highest office in the land.

The Bidens need to understand America’s security is not for sale. The U.S. presidency and vice presidency are not investment opportunities for eager foreign bidders. And no matter your family connections, you will not put the interests of the American people on the auction block.

2,977 innocent lives were lost on September 11, 2001 in the deadliest terrorist attack on American soil. Today and always we remember the victims, their families, and the first responders who risked their lives to save complete strangers in New York, Pennsylvania, and Virginia.
If you or someone you know is struggling, please call 988 or visit 998lifeline.org for 24/7 free and confidential support.

Today is World Suicide Prevention Day. As chairman of the VA Committee, this is an issue we’re working on a lot. According to the latest National Veteran Suicide Prevention report, 17 veterans commit suicide every day. Whether you’re a vet or not, help is out there.

It was great to see how the facility has thrived since opening back in July. I also got to see the Pilot Food Donation Garden and hear how residents are giving their time, coming together, and helping those in need.

A little over a year ago, I visited what would soon become the Rise Community Market in Cairo. It was good to be back, getting a tour of a market that has improved access to healthy, nutritious food for residents who hadn’t had access to a local grocery store since 2015.

Over in Mount Carmel, I attended a City Hall meeting with the Area Economic Development Board, city officials, and local small business owners. We discussed how we can get our local economies back on track. I also got to hold the key to the city!

Wabash Valley College President Matt Fowler gave me a tour of campus. It was great to hear about all the college offers to students in the area. It reinforces the fact that young people in Southern Illinois can receive a quality, affordable education right here at home.

I stopped by the Wabash General Hospital for a tour with President & CEO Karissa Turner. I had the pleasure of meeting with the team of committed healthcare specialists & had some constructive conversations about working together to increase standards of care across Southern IL.

Mt. Carmel mayor Joe Judge joined me for a tour of B&G Machine today with the company’s owner, Greg Odom. It was great to learn more about their technologies for the automotive industry and discuss my role on the Transportation and Infrastructure Committee.

I met with President Don Price and members of the board of the First National Bank of Mt. Carmel today. Founded in 1906, the bank remains locally owned and is the largest financial institution headquartered in Wabash County.

It was great to get an update on the research going on at the University of Illinois’ Dixon Springs Agricultural Center in Simpson yesterday. The ag center’s research in livestock is vital for making sure new generations of family farmers have the best resources available.

Sam Thompson gave me a tour today of Metropolis’ Southgate Nursing and Rehab, a facility that has been operating in Southern Illinois for more than 60 years. It was great to meet the team and hear about the great work they’re doing to serve the local community.

Today was a special day visiting with Southern Illinoisans who give so much of their time to help neighbors in need. To the teams at Tristate Food Bank and Arrowleaf Food Pantry: thank you for all you do to strengthen our communities!

I want to wish everyone a happy and relaxing Labor Day. We’ll say goodbye to summer, but let’s also take the moment to celebrate the hardworking men and women who make Southern Illinois a great place to live, work, and raise a family.

I visited the Salem American Legion Post 128, the birthplace of the G.I. Bill of Rights. The table above us is the same table the bill was written on. I had a great time speaking with fellow veterans and discussing my role as Chairman of the House Veterans Affairs Committee.

Thank you to everyone that attended my legislative update at the Marion County Courthouse in Salem last week. I had some constructive conversations with city officials about the upcoming appropriation bills to be voted on later this month.

Best thing since sliced bread? Try touring the Bettendorf-Stanford facility in Salem, original manufacturer of the micro bread slicer & slicer blades. I had a great experience at the world’s premier food slicing equipment company that’s been family owned and operated since 1965.

I had the pleasure of speaking with Mr. Knox’s Centralia High School class about the importance of being engaged in government and the political process. I had a fun time meeting with these leaders of tomorrow and know that our future is in good hands.
I stopped by Centralia’s One Hope United and had some great conversations with their dedicated team about their various programs empowering and uplifting children and families in our community.
It was very nice to meet the City Manager, Kory Smith, as well and to discuss how we can work together to make sure our water is safe and clean.
Mayor Kuder was kind enough to offer a tour of Centralia’s Water Treatment Plant earlier this week to discuss future projects the city has planned to improve their water supply.

I visited the St. Louis Downtown Airport in Cahokia Heights this week to tour their recent expansion projects and discuss how the upcoming FAA reauthorization will positively impact our airports and travelers to and from Southern Illinois.

September is #NationalRecoveryMonth, and I want to share some important information about how we can combat overdoses in our community. In March, the @US_FDA approved the first over-the-counter naloxone nasal spray. Here's what you need to know:
With the Farm Bill and an agricultural appropriations bill on the horizon, we talked a lot about how my service on the House Agriculture Committee can help deliver for Illinois ag.
I headed up to Decatur earlier this week for the Farm Progress Show, the largest outdoor farm show in the country. Great seeing many Southern Illinois farmers, producers, and ranchers in attendance.

The Leadership Council of Southwestern Illinois is instrumental in growing local economies in counties across our district. It was a pleasure to meet with these local leaders & present them with a Congressional Record certificate celebrating the organization’s 40th anniversary.

Today is International Overdose Awareness Day. As a father & grandfather, it's gut-wrenching to hear stories of personal tragedy & loss due to opioids. These are moms & dads, sons & daughters, neighbors & friends. Here’s how you can help identify the signs and symptoms of an OD.

Nearly 20,000 households in Southern Illinois rely on propane gas to keep warm, cook dinner, or operate equipment. I enjoyed meeting with Southern FS in Carbondale about how we can ensure a stable, all-of-the-above market for meeting our energy needs.

I kicked this busy week off bright and early in Shiloh, where I attended a breakfast hosted by the @afpillinois. The topic: Stopping Bidenomics. It was a pleasure to break bread with concerned constituents as we discussed ways to reduce overregulation & empower working families.
It's mind-boggling that Biden remains undeterred in his quest to push farming families out of business, even after being rebuffed by the highest court in the land.

The SCOTUS struck down Biden’s disastrous WOTUS rule which would put farmers/producers out of business. So what does Biden do? Gives it another go. Our farmers need consistency, not varying degrees of bureaucratic overreach that changes on a whim.

If you’re a student from 6th grade to a senior in High School, I invite you to participate in the Congressional App Challenge. Create a winning app for mobile phones, the web, PC, tablet, or any other platform to earn national recognition!

congressionalappchallenge.us

Tracy & I are sending our prayers to the family & friends of 3 Marines killed in an MV-22B Osprey crash in Australia on Sunday, including Capt. Eleanor LeBeau from Belleville. She will be greatly missed by the community she dedicated her life to protect. RIP Marine, Semper Fi.

Two years ago today, 13 brave US servicemembers were killed in the deadliest attack on Americans in Afghanistan since 2011 due to Biden’s disastrous withdrawal from the region. May their memories never be forgotten.
Our farmers turned out in big numbers bright & early, and that helped kick off a great ag tour on Wednesday!

Check out this article from @FarmWeekNow on my Farm Bill Listening Session in Altamont with House Ag GOP Chairman GT Thompson. Good summary of the major issues discussed. farmweeknow.com/policy/natio…
Thanks to @TATravelCenters, @bp_America, and @NATSO_Inc for joining me for a great event today!

I grew up in a family trucking company, so I was excited for "Take Your Congressman to Work Day" at the TA truck stop in Mt. Vernon. I toured the facilities, met with employees & the truckers they serve, & highlighted the need for improved access to safe truck parking nationwide.

I stopped by Main Street Pastures in Breese today to speak with local farmers about priorities in the upcoming Farm Bill and my work on the House Agriculture Committee. I'll keep fighting to make sure our farmers have a voice in Washington, D.C.
Had a wonderful visit at Shiloh Middle School today. Always a pleasure to meet our future leaders and answer their questions about how our government works.

Yesterday I visited Helia Healthcare in Benton to discuss senior care and challenges our healthcare workers face in the field. It was great to meet with such a committed and caring staff that help make sure our community is well taken care of.
This morning I visited Veterans Airport in Marion to discuss their recent expansion, which includes new direct flights to Chicago. Excited to see our region opened up to new travelers.
The Illinois Supreme Court has upheld Pritzker's unconstitutional gun grab. We must, and we will, continue in our battle to preserve and protect our CONSTITUTIONAL Second Amendment rights!
The House Oversight Committee released bank records today showing the Biden family & their business partners received $20 million from foreign actors during his time as VP.

Join me today in recognizing National Purple Heart Day, a time to honor the brave men and women who were injured or killed in brave service to our country. Their selfless sacrifice and valor will never be forgotten.

Tracy and I are so sorry to hear that 5-year-old Harper Finn passed away late Wednesday evening from injuries suffered last weekend at the Effingham County Fair. Our prayers and thoughts are with her family, friends, and all in the Altamont community who are close to them.
More than three quarters of voters believe that if a baby is born alive, their lives should be protected. This isn't some niche, wedge issue. The American people are on the side of LIFE.
Another day, another attempt by the Biden administration to take down Donald J. Trump. I still stand with President Trump and countless Southern Illinoisans do too!

Tracy & I are praying for 5 y/o Harper Finn, who was seriously injured at the Effingham County Fair last weekend. The local community is rallying to the family's side after her tragic accident. May God watch over them during this incredibly difficult time.effinghamdailynews.com/news/…

Congress approved my amendment to H.R. 4366 stopping the VA from sending names to the DOJ for background checks because they need help managing their finances. Proud to have @NRA, @GunOwners, and @NatlGunRights support in this effort to protect veterans’ Second Amendment rights!
Thank you @GunOwners, I will always stand up for our second amendment rights.
Hunter Biden's plea deal fell apart today after a federal judge expressed concerns over his weapons charge. Biden's two-tiered system of justice cannot stand.
We look forward to being your advocate and doing all we can to help. If you have any questions in the meantime, feel free to reach out to our Murphysboro office at (618) 457-5787.

My staff will be hosting mobile office hours in Pinckneyville tomorrow on July 26th to give Perry County residents an opportunity to talk with our casework experts face-to-face about questions you may have regarding veterans’ benefits, Social Security, Medicare, the IRS & more.
Today I met with the Illinois Corn Growers Association and FFA leaders from across Southern Illinois. It was a pleasure to meet these young people and discuss the importance of Illinois agriculture!

There’s an easy fix to the migrant crisis, and it isn’t housing them in our schools. Biden and Mayorkas need to get serious about border security - finish the wall, invest in border patrol, and end catch and release.

Tonight I'll be voting for the Schools Not Shelters Act, which bans politicians from using public schools to house illegal migrants. Sheltering unscreened migrants in schools is dangerous to students/teachers & limits their access to facilities & the services they need.

The IL Supreme Court upheld Pritzker’s elimination of cash bail. The SAFE-T act is another example of radical leftists sacrificing public safety to score points with their political base. Cash bail exists for a reason: to protect victims & keep dangerous criminals off the street.

A leader of the House Democrats called Israel a "racist state." This is what we're up against from the radical left. I have never wavered in my support for Israel, our steadfast ally and beacon of freedom in the Middle East, and I never will. nypost.com/2023/07/16/rep-ja…
We look forward to being your advocate and doing all we can to help. If you have any questions in the meantime, feel free to reach out to our Effingham office at (217) 240-3170.

My staff will be hosting mobile office hours in Toledo on Thursday, July 20th to give Cumberland County residents an opportunity to talk with our casework experts face-to-face about questions you may have regarding veterans’ benefits, Social Security, Medicare, the IRS & more.

❌ No funding for abortion services 

❌ No funding for Critical Race Theory 

❌ No funding for gender identity and social justice initiatives 

❌ No funding for climate change programs

House Republicans passed a Defense Authorization bill today that includes: 

✅ $886 billion for national defense 

✅ 5.2% pay raise for active duty servicemembers 

✅ Reforms to strengthen fiscal accountability at the Pentagon 

✅ Funding to counter Chinese aggression

House Republicans just passed the Defense Authorization bill, setting military funding priorities for the next fiscal year. Big win for servicemembers and a reminder to Biden that our military’s primary focus should be on national defense, not scoring points with his woke base.

When I wrote a bill to increase safe parking for tractor trailers, critics said it wasn't a priority. Now, 3 are dead, over a dozen injured in Madison County due to bus colliding with trucks parked on offramp. fox2now.com/video/a-deeper-l…

Yesterday I met with my friend, Dr. Steve Webb, the Goreville School Superintendent. It was great catching up and discussing efforts to enhance educational opportunities in Goreville. Thanks for all you've done for education in Southern Illinois, Steve.

As chairman of the House VA Committee, I was honored to recently lead a congressional delegation to Europe to meet with active-duty U.S. servicemembers and pay respects at our WWI and WWII memorial sites. I also met with a few constituents who happened to be visiting as well.

We must expand access to safe truck parking so drivers aren't forced to rest on the side of busy roadways. I'm speaking shortly with the chairman of the National Transportation Safety Board about this urgent public safety matter.

Devastating accident in Madison County early this morning. Three tractor trailers parked  overnight on an I-70 exit ramp were sideswiped by a Greyhound bus. There were three fatalities and over a dozen injuries. kmov.com/2023/07/12/3-dead-1…

Great meeting with friends from the Illinois Soybean Association today. Illinois grows more soy than any other state, and I’m proud to represent Southern Illinois’ farmers on the House Agriculture Committee during a critical Farm Bill year.

I’m hosting a telephone town hall this Thursday at 6:15 PM central time to hear from YOU! I hope you’ll be able to join us!

📞 Thursday at 6:15 PM CT
❓ What questions do you have?
📋 Sign up to participate at bost.house.gov/participate

Last night the VFW post outside Scott Air Force Base hosted a Veterans Forum hosted by @ConcernedVets. We discussed my role as chairman of the House VA Committee; my legislation increasing accountability at Biden’s VA; & how we can help veterans get the benefits/care they earned.
We look forward to being your advocate and doing all we can to help. If you have any questions in the meantime, feel free to reach out to our Murphysboro office at (618) 457-5787.

My staff is hosting mobile office hours in Carmi on Tuesday, July 10th to give White County residents an opportunity to talk with our casework experts face-to-face regarding their veterans' benefits, Social Security, Medicare, the IRS and more.
Happy Independence Day, Southern Illinois! Tracy and I hope everyone has a happy and safe 4th of July.

SCOTUS issued 2 decisions today: one affirming the First Amendment right of business owners to decline services that violate religious beliefs, and another striking down Biden's student loan bailout. It's been an important week in protecting the rights of the American people.

Today's Supreme Court decision striking down Affirmative Action in college admissions was long overdue. Students should be rewarded based on merit, not race-based quotas. The system will now be fairer for all.

Due to the Left's open border policies, some schools are housing illegal migrants, using resources that should be for the betterment of our children. It isn't right or safe. That's why I'm voting for H.J. Res. 461 to block politicians from using our schools for migrant housing.
We look forward to being your advocate and doing all we can to help. If you have any questions in the meantime, feel free to reach out to our Murphysboro office at (618) 457-5787.

My staff is hosting mobile office hours in Cairo on Tuesday, June 27th to give Alexander County residents an opportunity to talk with our casework experts face-to-face regarding their veterans' benefits, Social Security, Medicare, the IRS and more.

Hunter Biden received a slap on the wrist despite growing evidence that he engaged in a scheme of corruption that could put America’s security at risk. The Republican-led House Oversight Committee will keep fighting to get to the bottom of this influence peddling operation.

This is my first Father's Day without my dad, Gene Bost. Not a day goes by that I don't reflect upon the values he instilled in us: faith, family, hard work, and love of country. We miss him greatly. May today be a special Father's Day for all the dads across Southern Illinois!

Biden announced he’s appointed Mandy Cohen as his new director of the CDC. As health sec in NC, she imposed draconian COVID restrictions in schools, many proven to be useless or ineffective. So when exactly does Biden start to "follow the science"?

Today, Cairo's historic community opens Rise Community Market - their first grocery store in 7+ years, offering fresh & nutritious food closer to home. A hopeful sign of more investment in this proud city at the Mississippi & Ohio rivers confluence. kfvs12.com/2023/05/11/grand-…

That's why today I voted for the REINS Act, which would require congressional approval before an administration can impose a new major rule. This would have stopped Biden’s student loan giveaway, his ban on oil and gas leases, and his plan to federalize our elections.

President Biden has consistently abused executive power and eluded congressional approval to enact his extreme, liberal agenda. In his first year, he added $200 billion in new regulatory costs and then piled on another $1 trillion last year.
Happy 248th birthday to our United States Army! Thank you to the generations of men and women who have served and who continue to serve.

Happy #FlagDay, Southern Illinois! On June 14th, 1777, the Second Continental Congress adopted the first American flag. While its number of stars may have changed over the past 246 years, it remains the world’s greatest symbol of freedom and American exceptionalism.
We don’t need D.C. bureaucrats and climate activists telling us how to prepare dinner for our family – talk about too many cooks in the kitchen.

Natural gas stoves are preferred by 40% of homeowners. Tracy and I have one in our home. But there’s never been a regulation that Joe Biden didn’t like, so now he’s gunning for your gas top. I’m heading to the House floor now to proudly vote to block the gas stove ban.
We look forward to being your advocate and doing all we can to help. If you have any questions in the meantime, feel free to reach out to our Murphysboro office at (618) 457-5787.

My staff will be hosting mobile office hours in McLeansboro MONDAY, JUNE 12th to give Hamilton County residents an opportunity to talk with our casework experts face-to-face about any questions you may have regarding veterans’ benefits/Social Security/Medicare/the IRS etc.

For decades SNAP has been anti-work, creating a long-term dependency on the gov that makes it almost impossible to stand on your own. We must have stronger requirements for healthy, working age SNAP recipients to work, be looking for work, or be engaged in a job training program.

As a member of the House Agriculture Committee, I participated in a hearing this week on modernizing the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program. Food assistance programs provide a critical lifeline when families face hard times, but they aren’t a permanent way of life.

Tonight is the next step in the Democrats’ coordinated effort targeting Donald J. Trump. They’re trying to derail his frontrunner campaign for the presidency, despite the fact that Joe Biden, himself, had classified documents strewn across the Mid-Atlantic region!

I’ll say it again: if you’re a farmer in Effingham, work in the building trades in Marion, are a stay-at-home mom in Waterloo or a teacher in Harrisburg who worked hard to pay off your loans, it is wrong to force you to foot the bill for someone else’s decision to go to college.

Joe Biden vetoed last night a House Republican bill that blocks his student loan giveaway. Presidential vetoes are rare, but Biden is ready and willing if it means he can force the 87% of Americans who have no student loans to pay for those who do.

REMINDER: My staff is hosting mobile office hours in Elizabethtown today. If you're in Hardin County and need help with federal issues, stop by 156 Locust Street until 3pm to meet with our casework experts!

2,501.

That’s how many Americans gave their lives on the beaches of Normandy in defense of freedom across the world. As we mark the 79th anniversary of D-Day, we honor the courage & sacrifice of these heroes. Please take a moment to salute the flag & servicemen lost in battle.

Israel is one of our greatest allies. I was honored to speak at the International Leaders Summit today celebrating Israel's 75th anniversary. As we celebrate this historic milestone, let us renew our commitment to working together to build a better future for our children.
